result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamul B Pitts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from defendant re sentence modification

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
case is called briefly at 2:15pm, and then at 2:20pm 
Defendant Shamul B Pitts appears from Oshkosh Correctional, in custody. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled on Mr. Pitts 12/14/20 Motion to Modify Sentence and his 12/30/20 Response regarding the Court's letter raising that no new factor has been shown. 
Mr. Pitts makes a statement in support of his Motion.  
DA Hall gives brief argument in opposition. 
The Court finds that new factor has been shown. The Court denies the Motion. 
The Court indicates to Mr. Pitts that he may draft a proposed order, if he wishes to have a signed order denying the Motion for appeal purposes.
recess 2:41pm.

Case called at 11:22am [ma]
Defendant Shamul B Pitts in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Hall submits victim impact statement 

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts 3 through 7

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Pitts

On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Pitts to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is to be served consecutive to previously imposed sentence.

On Count #2: The Court sentences Mr. Pitts   to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling  as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/ or education program per Agent
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay restitution to Finishline in the amount of: $100 joint but several with co-actor
--to pay restitution to Famous Footwear in the amount of: $100 joint but several with co-actor
--to pay restitution to Maurices in the amount of: $100 joint but several with co-actor
--to pay restitution to Zumiez in the amount of: $100 joint but several with co-actor
--to pay restitution to Bath and Body Works in the amount of: $100 joint but several with co-actor
--to provide DNA sample upon demand

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

Motion hearing on October 25, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 3:09pm. 
Defendant Shamul B Pitts appear via videoconferencing from Kettle Moraine Correctional Institute, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa, appears in court. DA Susan Happ appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
After making inquiries of Mr. Pitts, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however DA Happ explains that the State did not learn of Mr. Pitts' incarceration-location in time to have a writ for the transport of Mr. Pitts occur. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is requesting that Mr. Pitts be produced for the Prelimary Hearing.
The Court will reschedule the Preliminary Hearing promptly; the Court notes that dates are already set for FSSC and Jury Trial in this case.   
recess 3:16pm. 

NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 10/3/16 at 8:30am--send notices; State is to prepare Writ  (2) the November FSSC and Jury Trial dates remain on the Court's calendar

[MK] case called at 1:   pm. 
Defendant Shamul B Pitts appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall 
--no contact with Gabrielle Silvas
recess 1:30pm.
